title: Rome State Airport
text:
Rome State Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located 20 <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (23 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 37 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Rome%2C%20Oregon">Rome</a>, in <a href="Malheur%20County%2C%20Oregon">Malheur County, Oregon</a>, United States. It is owned by the <a href="Oregon%20Department%20of%20Aviation">Oregon Department of Aviation</a>.
History.
The airport was built by the <a href="United%20States%20Army%20Air%20Forces">United States Army Air Forces</a> about 1942, and was known as Rome Flight Strip. It was an emergency landing airfield for military aircraft on training flights. It was closed after <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, and was turned over for local government use by the War Assets Administration (WAA).
Facilities and aircraft.
Rome State Airport covers an area of 147 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (59 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 4,053 feet (1,235 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 3/21 with a <a href="gravel">gravel</a> surface measuring 6,000 by 150 feet (1,829 x 46 m). For the 12-month period ending May 13, 2009, the airport had 100 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 8 per month.
